I'm [Ed Rubin](bio.html), an assistant professor in the [Department of Economics](https://economics.uoregon.edu) at the [University of Oregon](https://www.uoregon.edu).

### research

I'm an environmental economist who researches how human behavior (individual and policy) affects social equity and the health of the natural world.

As an empiricist, I tackle these issues with a toolbox that draws from econometrics, statistics, and data science.

Examples from a few recent projects…
<br>↳ [*unequal health impacts from glyphosate exposure*](https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.2413013121)
<br>↳ [*curiously missing data in air-quality monitors*](https://doi.org/10.1162/rest_a_01477)
<br>↳ [*disparate wildfire smoke avoidance*](Papers/draft-smoke.pdf)
<br>↳ [*a field experiment in customer-based gender bias*](https://www.journals.uchicago.edu/doi/abs/10.1086/733049)
<br>↳ [*pitfalls of machine learning in a 2SLS framework*](https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2505.13422)
<br>↳ [*strategic location of coal-fueled power plants*](Papers/draft-plant-locations.pdf)
